I love this game so much but I have a few issues with it. I wish dlc's were transferable. I had almost every dlc that was out in late 2020 on my ps4 but then I had to give my brother the console after I got my gaming laptop for school. I have still re-bought many of the dlc, it is just annoying i could not transfer them. The other problem I have with this game is that the survivor lobbies take for ever to match make. Is there literally no other way they can improve that? It is so bad that when I played for 4 hours last week I was only able to get into 4 games that did not even last 15 minutes each. Don't get me wrong I love this game I just wish it was at least faster to match make.

O Jogo é bom, o único problema do game é que ele é mal balanceado, você pode estar no rank mais baixo, mas mesmo assim você vai cai contra os ranks mais altos. Fora o balanceamento, o resto é tudo ótimo, prícipalmente as DLC que estão vindo ai, já q a próxima é do ''O CHAMADO'' trazendo como killer, provavelmente a SAMARA (eu acho). Recomendo muito, pois pode te dar um grande tempo de entretenimento, e talves um pouquinho de stress. RECOMENDO, PODE COMPRAR.

DBD is forever the game I come back to. No matter what other game I get invested in there's always a pull towards DBD. The community can be pretty toxic at times, but you can also find some of the greatest people there. I've made solid friends through Dead By Daylight, and if you go in with the intention to have fun the sweaty killers don't suck so much. It's got it's quirks, but the devs work so hard to make the game balanced. As far as multiplayer horror games go, this one is SO polished. I love it, I highly recommend it. And if you need someone to show you the ropes, hit me up! I love teaching new survivors how to play this game <3

Dead by Daylight is an experience that may give players a really good time, or just give them straight up cancer. Before buying this game, I'd recommend researching a bit to truly see if it's the game for you. Remember that you can always refund within a 2-hour play-time + purchased within a 2-week basis. Dead by Daylight is a game where it's mechanics are simply just an intense/spooky game of cat-and-mouse. I really like this! The survivors are tasked to repair damaged power generators, which will power the exit gates to escape, while the killer... well... Attempts to kill the survivors. The survivors will be working on such generators and then will flee the area once a threatening presence, the killer, is near. The killer will be searching the map for the survivors and chase them down. This seems pretty self-explanatory, but there's a good reason for me explaining this. Do you find fun in outsmarting and outdoing the opposition? Or will you find this type of game-play tedious to the point of driving you crazy? Many players in this game are toxic as **** in this game. Cocky-like players will 100% show you their unsportsmanlike gestures. For me, every tedious defeat I have, I take it educationally instead of quitting the game; I always want to improve. Throughout my epic gamer moments, I fell in love with this game. As said before, opinions definitely vary; I find this game as a worthy purchase due to the potentially, very fun experiences you can have by playing by yourself, or with a group of friends. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here are some extra thoughts I have:

1. Expect LONG-ASS MATCHMAKING TIMES!!!! Due to the current feeling from the killer community, there are not enough killers anymore to fulfill the matchmaking demands. Survivors might even be waiting 5 minutes on average for games sometimes. (Although there are thousands of players on at the same time)

2. I believe that Dead by Daylight uses Skill-Based Matchmaking, focusing on the competitive element. It's difficult to doodle around and still win in higher ranked games. 

3. If you're playing as survivor, your experience can be a lot more fun, exciting, and tactical if you bring friends along with you. 

4. If you're willing to play killer, ignore the toxic survivor attitude and use your defeats as something to improve on. Use it to get better for next time. 

5. If you're willing to play survivor alone, which means lack of communication, be as self-aware as possible. If a fellow survivor is dying on the hook and the other survivors are busy repairing generators, it might be a good idea to see if you can save the dying teammate if possible. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hope this helps!

Alle drei Partien muss ich 30 Minuten warten, bis das aktuelle Update verdaut ist.
Die anderen Spieler warten auf einen, und ich guck auf den Ladebalken :/ 

Und mein Hauptkritikpunkt:
Bei dieser Variante von 'Verstecken spielen' mit Bastelstunde
empfinde ich mich als Überlebender eher als bezahlender NPC für den Jäger.
Also bin ich der freiwillige Ersatz für eine gut geschriebene Survivor KI.

Deshalb kann ich trotz den manchmal netten Abenden dass Spiel nicht wirklich empfehlen.

Eher Left4Dead oder sowas.
